comment: I absolutely love this professor very understanding he gave extensions when needed. Majority of the work was writing, four discussions and then four weekly reflections and then the rest. Quizzes were lockdown lockdown was the same question quizzes. Be prepared to read the textbook
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--So many papers

comment: Professor Ronnenberg is a very easygoing person. I took his class online and all his class consisted of was a quiz every week (no lockdown), 4 discussion posts, 4 reflections, and midterm/final (lockdown w/ webcam). Super simple class!
rating_tags: Caring--Accessible outside class--Online Savvy

comment: Ronnenberg is a nice guy, but as a prof he is disorganized and unclear. Sure, a research seminar is meant to be self driven, but no rubrics, no deadlines, and the AUDACITY to give NUMERICALLY SCORED feedback with no elaboration should be criminal. I gave him a 2 because he genuinely is an “ok” prof. Not the worst ever, but certainly not the best.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Straightforward class. 4 reflections and discussion posts, 15 quizzes, and a midterm/final. He does take a while to grade assignments, and he is not very present in his class. However, it does not matter since a lot of the required assignments are self-paced and do not have a strict due date. Midterm and final are lockdown browser with webcam.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Graded by few things

comment: Just took Dr. Ronnenberg for Spring 2025, great a teacher and easy class. You have 4 primary source discussions, 4 writing reflections, a weekly quiz (no lockdown browser), and a midterm/final (lockdown browser/webcam). You do have to buy a textbook with your own money though so keep that in mind.
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Clear grading criteria--Graded by few things

comment: Lectures can be dry, but the material is engaging. Take diligent notes and use unstuck ai for efficient study prep. Tests are tough, but doable if you stay on top of it.
His lectures are interesting and you are only graded on a paper. No test or assignments. He is also a nice, funny, and interesting person. I enjoyed this class alot.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback--Graded by few things

comment: Very very lecture heavy, but very few assignments. Make sure to watch all of the lectures and take good notes.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework--Graded by few things

comment: Teaching is very lecture focused. If you take good notes and can lock in on what is being said then you will do well. 3 exams with 20 percent weight each and a 200 word essay worth 15 percent. Interesting and engaging material most of the time.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: he's cool! his lectures can be a bit boring though, even though i learned a lot. 3 tests including the final + a short paper. if i would've actually gone to this class, i would have done way better.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: I didn't find this class too difficult, but you have to exert yourself and take notes every class. His lectures are long but they are very informative and info-dense. He has very few tests that'll be very easy if you take notes. If you're taking 1112, DON'T BUY THE TEXTBOOK! I didn't open it once and I got an A cuz he covers everything in class.

Very easy class course-work wise. We only had a few assignments through the whole semester. The quizzes and tests are very tough, though, and come from random small details from the textbook and lengthy lectures--(which often get off topic and on tangents). The professor is a very nice guy and really cares, though, and I would take again.
rating_tags: Lecture heavy--Graded by few things--Online Savvy

comment: This class is extremely lecture-heavy but he only hits the main points you need to know for a few minutes at a time. He is very kind and cares a lot about what he is teaching, but sometimes the course is muddled by long lectures and constant conceptual topics. Make sure to take notes and study before each exam and you will do well.
rating_tags: Lecture heavy--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Dr. Ronnenberg's lectures go beyond the basic fact memorization I was accustomed to with past history classes. If you're looking for a class with a more basic approach, it probably isn't him. But, if you're looking for an introduction to more high-level discussion, I highly recommend him! He doesn't ever answer his email, though. Very few grades.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Seems like a decent person outside of class, however, aloof regarding his students and rants during lectures. Also doesn't respond to emails so you will not receive the help needed if any. You will have to fend for yourself and try to keep up in this course.

He seemed like a nice guy. This class is lecture heavy and his mic is pretty foggy so its hard to understand the content sometimes. Three tests based on the lectures all on lockdown but no camera. If you take good notes its pretty doable. A couple of discussion posts and a couple of podcasts you make but its a completion grade and super easy.
rating_tags: Lecture heavy--Test heavy

comment: He is an okay professor but has unhelpful power points and lectures, he rants in the lectures so much that it is impossible to understand what will be needed for the class and what are just cool facts. There is a lot of reading to do for this class and the tests are hard but barely manageable if you study well. There is a lot of homework too.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Lecture heavy--Test heavy

comment: He's an okay teacher his powerpoints aren't helpful and he tends to ramble about stuff. You'll need to go to class if you want to pass because the study guide is just the key concepts that you'll need to go through your notes. His test is in lockdown and the webcam. If you can find someone better go with it if not this is your second-best option
rating_tags: Participation matters--Lecture heavy--Test heavy

comment: Even though I wouldn't take his class again, Dr. Ronnenberg is great. He is one of the only professors that I've had that is beyond passionate about his field of study. Beware of tests though, his lectures do not give much if any, you will NEED to buy the textbook and self teach! He is quite flexible though.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Inspirational--Graded by few things

comment: Professor Ronnenberg is a great professor, but he can talk the whole class which can be a bit too much. Also, your grade is based on three tests (the final is not cumulative) and an easy paper. Though attendance is not mandatory, GO TO THE LECTURES!!! It will be hard to pass a test if you do not go to the lectures.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: I feel bad for saying this, but he is not qualified to teach this course. We did not learn the content we should have been learning. His only grades were the 3 exams. If you have other options, definitely consider those. He's really nice, but just not the best professor for this specific course.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Professor R is a fun guy and very passionate. This class only has 3 grades all being take home essay's. I personally found them difficult but he is a easy grader. He does not have visuals and taking notes are difficult because he rambles.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Ronnenberg is a nice guy and has lots of knowledge. His lectures are generally interesting but are not guided with visuals so it is just him rambling, which can be confusing and dry. 3 tests all essay formats, open notes and open for several days. I got decent grades on all of them without taking notes or having to study.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Dr. Ronnenburg has a phenomenal wealth of knowledge over a lot of historical subjects. However, this class is lecture and reading heavy; by heavy, I mean that's all the instruction. Nearly fell asleep in a few lectures but he is very laid back and isn't assignment-heavy. Only had three take-home tests, basically essays but like 600-800 words per.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Gives good feedback--Lecture heavy

comment: Few tests, quizzes, discussions, 1-minute podcasts, and 1 essay (200 words). No deadlines, except tests. The material is very hard and his lecture recordings are super long. If you listen to his recordings, easy to get an A. Started off not listening to his lectures and failed quizzes! But he is caring and helped me a lot! Tough grader on writing
rating_tags: Lecture heavy--Caring--Tough grader

comment: Professor Ronnenberg is one of the nicest professors I have ever had. He is so understanding and willing to give you additional time if needed. He mainly lectures, but they are pretty entertaining and they help out with the tests. I would definitely recommend his class.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Amazing lectures--Caring

comment: Only choose this professor if he is in person, not online. His mic is trash and his 'podcasts' are barely understandable. Not to mention the audio files are still broken after half the semester for some of us, so you'll have to download some to even listen. His exams are based off of his lectures (I bet you can see why that might be difficult).
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things

comment: Lecture heavy and reading heavy. Modules every 3 days, each module has one or two chapters to read and a lecture recorded by him. these lectures are recorded at a very low quality level- background noise, muffling, just poor audio in general. I wanted to drop this class so bad but we have to take it for our general education requirement here at KSU
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Test heavy--Lecture heavy

comment: Ronnenberg is an ok professor. He is essentially impossible to get in touch with and has never responded to any that my classmates or I have sent this semester. The class feels like recycled lectures and power points. They are hard to get through and the power points were pretty unhelpful to me. He never puts in grades either. Extremely boring.
rating_tags: Lecture heavy

comment: Although I didn't really learn much past knowing it for the exams, I really enjoyed Dr. Ronnenberg's class. He posted his lecture slides and the corresponding podcasts in each module and almost everything he tested on was something he said in his podcasts. Super easy if you take good notes. Few other grades but the 3 tests weighed the most.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Test heavy--Lecture heavy

comment: Overall easy class if you keep up with all the assignments that are in the modules. Excused me for an exam I didn't get to take because I had COVID. Probably the kindest, most understanding professor I've ever had! Fast communicator to students and his assignments are so much fun. Taking him next semester because he's great!
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Lecture heavy--Caring

comment: Hard. Lecture heavy.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Lecture heavy--Test heavy

comment: Took history 1110 as a summer class. consists of 3 tests, podcasts, weekly quizzes, and a few discussion boards. All of the answers for tests and quizzes are in his podcasts that have horrible sound quality. He tends to ramble within his podcasts, taking longer than usual to get to the point. Dont buy the book.
rating_tags: Lecture heavy

comment: Im currently taking this as a summer class and it is a lot of work. His Ppts are not in depth so listen to all of the podcasts for information. The book is not much help either. Its hard to read and very scattered. He also uses lockdown browser and webcam as well. If you want a summer class or online class thats manageable, not the class for you
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lecture heavy--Tough grader

comment: One word, Get to the POINT. Don't get me wrong. I can appreciate the fact of someone being very interested in something they like, but don't try too make me like it. He drags on in his lectures, but you must listen cause his test answers are in it. The work itself is not hard, 3 test, some discussion post, 3 one min podcast, easy quizzes.
rating_tags: TEST HEAVY--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: He is the great and easy professor.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Respected--Get ready to read

comment: This was my 2nd time taking this professor. All of his classes are lecture heavy, no power points, and nothing posted on d2l, so you need to attend class. Some lectures are great and others are boring, but the class is pretty consistent. We had two midterms and a final, all essay-based, 2 short essays (200 words) and 1 long essay (600 words).
rating_tags: Respected--Caring--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: I have taken Dr. Ronneberg for two classes so far and he is one of my favorites! He is extremely down to earth and actually cares about his students and doesn't see us as money signs like many of the professors at KSU do. You won't regret taking him!
rating_tags: Hilarious--Caring--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: He was amazing. His podcasts and ppts were clear and interesting. The semester's work was clear and organized from the beginning. Topics were interesting and relevant. Only negatives were that i never could figure out my grade as the semester went along with his confusing calculation. Also, textbook chapters were long and boring, need better book.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Clear grading criteria--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: If you are looking for a class to find your answers on quizlet, this is not the class for you. He is very passionate about the subject and wants to make it interesting, but you have to listen to the podcasts to do well. I would have done better if I put in more effort, but it's just a boring subject to me.
rating_tags: Respected--Participation matters--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: He is very compassionate and understands that we all have different schedules. He allows plenty of time to complete assignments and grades fairly and quickly. I really enjoyed his teaching style. Super energetic and honestly made me enjoy history like I never had before.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Respected--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: I found Professor Ronnenberg to be a wonderful teacher. You can tell he is passionate about the subject and he tries to keep the lessons interesting. There is a decent amount of work required, but he grades fairly, and if you put some effort in you should pass with a good grade without too much difficulty. I really enjoyed his class.
Easy class as long as you do work and a very cool and lenient teacher.

This class was super easy. Three tests, a couple of quizzes, three discussion posts, a short paper, and you have to make three 1 minutes podcasts. The lectures are a little long and boring but almost all of the test answers are in them. He's a really easy grader too! I ended up with almost a 100 in the class! Definitely take him if you can!
His tests were pretty difficult. No matter how hard you try you won't find the answers online lol. Discussions and podcasts weren't too difficult.

Takes weeks to respond to emails, IF he actually decides to. Discussions & PS podcasts are easy. Short module quizzes are very easy also (pay attention to the LONG lecture podcasts or listen to it while taking them.)  Even though I made 100s on all assignments, the 2 midterms & 1 finalHARD (MAJOR part of letter grade & answers are NO WHERE online)

While he knows the subject, I don't recommend. He's TERRIBLE about answering emails, unclear, and VERY frustrating. I'm an A student, I LOVE African history and he made it hard for me to figure out what he wanted. I'd ask questions and he gave confusing answers, which conflicted with my other African history professor's. Don't take!

He's a great guy who is passionate about his studies. However, he tends to leave you hanging on what your grades are. Do each module one day a week, and you'll have yourself an A. I really don't see how one can fail this class? All in all, good professor, clear grading criteria, and minimal work required.

In general, a unprofessional professor. He grades assignments on a whim (consequently leaving you guessing as to what your grade is), attempted to berate me on a paper, boring lectures for a boring topic, neglected to remove questions we never covered on the final (did compensate however). He's basically negligent but his class is easy so thats a +

I took this class as an online course and it was very easy. Every few days you have a discussion post, podcast or a quiz, but I never got lower than an A on any of them. Keep up with the weekly modules and you will get an A in this course.

Ronnenberg is a great professor. His lectures are some of the most thought-provoking and interesting ones I have experienced in my entire college career. He gave three tests in our course, and these were our only grades. He grades fairly and gives you great feedback. If you do not go to class, you will not pass - it's that simple. Just go to class.

Don't take his online world history class unless you're ready to work. To compensate for no classes, he give you 45 minute podcasts each week that are required to pass the online assignmentsquizzes. Way more work than necessary. My upper level classes don't even require this much. Grades harshly too.

Four words: Pay attention in class! Much of the exams will cover what is discussed in class and you are expected to think critically, not just regurgitate what you read in the text. Prof has an engaging manner and keeps the discussions lively and interesting. Grades fairly hard. Attendance and participation are critical if you want an A.

The best professor i've had to date. Very intelligent and overall well 'knowledged'. He is passionate about African History and teaches in a way that draws you in. Must attend class to pass, as his exams are based off of his lectures. I highly recommend taking him, you will truly enjoy and learn not only class material, but life lessons as well!

Dr. R is HILARIOUS. He's a great teacher. KSU offers the best honors teachers! Easy class if you show up, participate, and pay attention :3 The test comes from basically the lecture, notes, and a little bit of common sense.

Dr. Ronnenberg is an extremely smart man. He has an answer for any question you present him, no matter how off topic it may be. The class is completely lecture based and if you attend class and take notes, it is an easy A. Attend the lectures because they are actually extremely entertaining and you learn interesting things throughout.  Take him.

This class is completely lecture based. No reason at all to buy the book unless you want to. If you come to class, write almost everything down (record class!!!!) come to class EVERY DAY!! His tests are almost verbatim his lectures. They aren't a walk in the park but they're online so as long as you take notes and attend class you're gold.

Absolutely loved this professor. He was extremely interesting and clear. He was very respectful to students both in class as well as respectful of their time outside of class. The exams are easy if you have been coming to class and paying attention. It's obvious that he is well educated on his subject and I absolutely recommend him.

Professor is a very good lecturer. Interesting presentation and generates great discussions in the class. Learned a good deal.  Needs to communicate assignments, grades, and syllabus changes more timely.

Wonderful professor who cares so much about his students. Makes the material fun and interesting. Tests are challenging but do-able. Just be sure to pay attention in class and take notes over the ideas he discusses. All tests are online so no excuse to not do well. I would love to take more classes with this professor.

Great professor, starts a LOT of discussion. Yes I dropped his class, but only because I wasn't grasping the course material, no fault of his at all. Highly recommended if you enjoy discussion-based classes.

Really wonderful professor. Classes were always interesting, and he tried to make them interesting and easy for the people who said they hated history. :) You might be able to get by without doing the reading, but do show up to class because his lectures are always fascinating. Almost no dates to memorize.

Dr. Ronnenberg is awesome! I would definitely take him again. I learned more from his may mester class than I learned in high school. Easy going guy and knows his history. Very helpful if you don't understand something too. I recommend showing up for his lectures because you won't be bored!

Dr. Ronnenberg is a great professor!  He is very easy going and his lecture is interesting.  Tests are fairly easy if you pay attention in class and take good notes. I would definitely take him again. Highly recommend!!!

His Approaches to World History class was very enjoyable. His lectures were fairly clear and easy to follow. Overall, he is a pretty easy going guy. He loves to talk about Africa. The end of course presentations on a region in the world were very fun, and it requred some group participation. I would take him again for a number of different courses.

Great prof, kind and understanding, explains anything you're confused about, knows his history, very interesting. It's not required to attend class, but you should. You can read the chapters instead of notes, but you will still get some questions wrong on tests (some are things only discussed in lecture). Definitely recommend this guy.
Definitely agree with all the prior postings! I really enjoyed his class. We never used the book so make sure to be in class so you can do well on the tests.

Nice professor, very clear and pretty easy. There are four tests and they are all online. No papers,no presentations or additional homework and he does not take role. His class is actually not boring, he's a fun guy. Take him!

SUCH an amazing professor. I absolutely loved every minute of his class, and I never liked history before. He's funny, interesting, and uses really creative ways to make the subject come alive. It's so much more than a lecture class. Also, he's just a cool dude and super fun to talk to. TAKE THIS CLASS!

I would agree with all the previous comments. There are only 4 tests in this class! THOSE ARE THE ONLY GRADES! He doesn't use the textbook at all. All notes are given through lecture or power point. He is a great teacher! It is beneficial to show up to class.

Dr. Ronnenberg is an awesome professor. Ignore the negative reviews from Freshmen. His tests are difficult only if you don't show up to class. If you are in class the test is straight forward, it will still challenge you, but it is still straight forward. I'm already trying to find other classes he is teaching so I can take them! HIGHLY RECOMMEND!!

This is the kind of professor everyone can agree is effective, uses more real life and updated multimedia offerings. I would also say that classes with him are a bargain, I mean he ties in elements of economy, math, physics, biology and other interdisciplinary means to make clear the topic,truly showing its impact in his history philosophy.
Great professor!! Go to class print out the notes on vista and take additional notes.. Tests are online

Laid back professor, pretty nice. Awfully boring class and the notes he gives in class sometimes do not pertain at all to the test. Even if you go to class and read the book, some of the class material will not cover the test questions. The book was a huge waste of money.

Ronnenberg is a very laid back. You need to come to class because reading the book is boring & his lectures, although note taking in this class is very hit & miss, are beneficial to taking the test. There's no homework, only 4 online tests. He curves his tests, so you should be okay. If you need homework to keep on track, try a different professor.

This class was really pretty easy if you went to class and took notes. Not sure what people have to complain about. Each test is curved and open notes. So even if you don't go to class you can still use your book on the test. Easy class, easy A

He is a very nice guy, but his class is extremly boring. He is also hard to follow while taking notes. You have to take notes in order to pass his class and the powerpoints he gives are not helpful in the least bit.

Very laid back, but can be confusing at times so pay attention. He does not use many powerpoints and his notes on the board will not be sufficient to pass a test. He does not have an attendance policy, but in order to pass his take home tests, it is necessary to go to class.

Good teacher, but can be confusing at times. Boring lectures every day but he attempts to make them interesting. All tests are online and timed. Tests are hard and almost completely lecture-based. Attend class and take notes til ur hand falls off and you'll be fine. The power points are not enough to pass a test!

This class was strictly lecture with take-home essay tests instead of written exams. He gives one week to finish the test which is comprised of materials that were clearly and extensively covered in class. Kinda boring actually. Wanted more political history and less weapon or family-life history. More time could have been spent on the countries, cultures, and international relations and less on how daughters are married, etc.

Helpful teacher he curves test and he gives extra credit. Take notes and pay attention has a total of four test which are online so make sure you work in a group when taking in the test so that you can pass =)easy B

This is one nice person and a very good professor. I had him for two classes and Im upset that his class is full this Spring. Fair in grading, very helpful, I could have made an A but had some personal issues. Take him you will love him.

Approaches to world history was so easy. I went to three classes total. the teacher himself is out there! He should have been a philosophy professor. Two tests that were take home and a group presentation. so easy. didn't learn much though.

I took this class as a Maymester class which was one of the best decisions I ever made! All tests & quizzes online; tests are short answer/essay, quizzes multiple choice, you should still study ahead of time though. Really funny & sarcastic! Tries to make class interesting but it IS world civ. I got an A in the class but had to work for it!

Definitely not an easy 'A' but I did still get an 'A.' The information is alot and his questions are tricky, but he does give useful study guides and his lectures are fairly entertaining-which is a plus because you WILL be behind if you miss any lectures. Took him for HiST 1110 in Maymester '09.
i am an A student and could not figure out what he wanted on his tests, what ever answer i put down was never correct, i got a B and now my GPA is lower.

Well...I hate history, but he is not one of those who just talks about what happened at what year. He is fun, sometimes it could be boring just cuz i took a may session class. But overall its amazing. not hard at all,online quizzes and tests. I got an A
Dr Ronnenberg is a great professor. His specialty is in African History, so he refers to that alot, but it is a very interesting class and I can't wait to take his class again this fall!
Very intelligent guy with a lot of passion for his subject. His lectures can be a little bland, but his tests are well-written. Good teacher, definitely recommended.

He is really helpful with whatever questions you have.  I never used any book that he assigned.  There was a take-home midterm and take-home final, group presentation, and participation in class and thats it, so your grades on those go a long way.  I would take him again in a heartbeat. His class was fun but also educational. Pay attention in class

What an awesome professor! I hope to take a class with him in the future, he was extrememly intelligent and interesting. Only 3 tests for this class based on a lot of lecture and readings - if you want to do well go to class! If you want to actually learn then take this class.
I took this class during the summer. It was easy, but boring. I took alot of notes, but his tests were online and not so bad. I would definitely take him again.

I took him for East south Central africa. He is great. We watched helpful videos that were not borrowing (ie nystrom) and they were not as much as hers either. hist essay test are pretty hard. he does look for a lot. but beside that, you will learn if you take him.

prof Ronnenberg, is the best lecturer av ever had.he is young and lively andvery interesting.i always thought history was boring and pointless but after taking it with him, i felt like changing my major.no assignments and i got straight A's in all my test, got exempt from the final

Dr. Ronnenberg is the most intelligent professor that I've ever had. His lectures can become very boring very quickly, but when he is lecturing on Africa it's very interesting. Tests are multiple choice/short answer. Study guide provided. No other assignments in the class.

Great professor. He really knows what he's talking about. Attendance isn't mandatory. I read all the chapters a couple of days before each test and got A's on the first 3 tests. Let's you drop your lowest test grade, including the final, so I never had to take the final. Easy class, but you'll learn a lot.

Dr. Ronnenberg's class was the most interesting and challenging class I've taken at KSU. He's extremely intelligent, well-spoken, thoughtful and super-freakin-hot. (Oh, I mean that in the strictest academic sense.)

Awesome teacher. i would not recommend taking the class during the summer bc lectures are so long. Great teacher, though, with great information, and very helpful. you actually learn stuff in this class instead of memorizing info for tests. loved the class. would recommend him for all.

He's a great professor. His lectures are interesting because he's able to make the connections between different points crystal clear. I would recommend him to anyone who wants to really learn about Africa.

Intro to world civ. He likes to draw his lectures out. Will become boring very quickly. I enjoy history and i found it boring. Although a good grade is easily obtainable through good writing. tests will be essay style and take home. Good and bad sides to that, time is good, but you will have to write a lot. My predicted grade when finished: B
